alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Davidson; Dickson; Robertson; Sumner; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 3:43PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Davidson, eastern Dickson, western Sumner, northern Williamson, northwestern Wilson, Cheatham, northeastern Hickman and Robertson Counties through 430 PM CST... At 342 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Coopertown to near Burns. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Gallatin, Springfield, Dickson, Ashland City, Nashville, Madison, Hendersonville, Brentwood, Mount Juliet, Goodlettsville, White House, Millersville, Greenbrier, Nolensville, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Coopertown, White Bluff and Belle Meade. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 170 and 223. Interstate 65 between mile markers 70 and 120. Interstate 24 between mile markers 18 and 63. Interstate 840 between mile markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for Middle Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Cheatham; Davidson; Dickson; Robertson; Sumner; Wilson
